title: Unexpected behavior in Spack fetching/concretization

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve. -->

I was trying to build an environment with new compilers, and then turn that into a container., on a machine with externals My break happens way early in that process.

As of develop this morning: if I have spack externals, Spack can get deeply confused about what it should fetch, in a way that gives _bizarre_ errors. In my situation, I had a spack external of diffutils v2.8.1, which is way before the versions Spack actually tracks (3.7). When I move to build gcc in an environment, spack concretized to have a gcc that depends on diffutils 2.8.1, and then proceed to download it. Problem being, the URL recipe that works for 3.7 doesn't work for 2.8.1. This manifests as a "no fetcher could retrieve diffutils v2.8.1" error, which was really unintuitive (@jrood-nrel and @michaelkuhn had to help me out on Slack).

An ideal fix for me would be Spack realizing that it's trying to fetch a package it doesn't know about. For me, I'd like that to lead to either a hard fail or Spack trying a different version. But I'm mostly reporting this so that you know about it, I won't be the last person to hit this behavior

### Steps to reproduce the issue

On a machine with ancient diffutils (MacOS Mojave in my case)

```console
spack external find
spack -d -k fetch diffutils
...
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
s1042027:spack-dev-env dzpolia$ spack --debug --stacktrace -k fetch diffutils
lib/spack/spack/main.py:469 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.745113] Warning: You asked for --insecure. Will NOT check SSL certificates.
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.750931] Imported fetch from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.751701] Imported fetch from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.759581] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/src/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.781398] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/src/spack/etc/spack/defaults/repos.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.783403] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/.spack/repos.yaml
lib/spack/spack/spec.py:2809 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.799225] diffutils applying constraint iconv
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.802167] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/src/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.832241] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/src/spack/etc/spack/defaults/darwin/packages.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.841169] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/.spack/packages.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.884150] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/.spack/darwin/compilers.yaml
lib/spack/spack/database.py:370 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.933133] DATABASE LOCK TIMEOUT: 3s
lib/spack/spack/database.py:374 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.933475] PACKAGE LOCK TIMEOUT: No timeout
lib/spack/spack/stage.py:323 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.964395] Creating stage lock spack-stage-diffutils-2.8.1-n62bprdvyvbl7qydcmblgmbd3xkawjge
lib/spack/spack/package.py:1333 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.964729] Warning: There is no checksum on file to fetch diffutils@2.8.1 safely.
lib/spack/llnl/util/tty/__init__.py:288 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:29.964871]   Fetch anyway? [y/N] y
lib/spack/spack/package.py:1344 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:31.851565] Fetching with no checksum. Add a checksum or use --no-checksum to skip this check.
lib/spack/spack/config.py:986 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:31.853981] Reading config file /Users/dzpolia/src/spack/etc/spack/defaults/mirrors.yaml
lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py:333 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:31.857276] Checking existence of https://mirror.spack.io/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz
lib/spack/spack/stage.py:497 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.123667] FailedDownloadError: Failed to fetch file from URL: https://mirror.spack.io/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz
    Urllib fetch failed to verify url https://mirror.spack.io/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz
lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py:333 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.124169] Checking existence of https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz
lib/spack/spack/stage.py:497 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.474393] FailedDownloadError: Failed to fetch file from URL: https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz
    Urllib fetch failed to verify url https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz
lib/spack/spack/stage.py:483 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.474774] Fetching from https://mirror.spack.io/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz failed.
lib/spack/spack/stage.py:483 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.475057] Fetching from https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/diffutils/diffutils-2.8.1.tar.xz failed.
lib/spack/spack/main.py:775 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.475289] FetchError: All fetchers failed
lib/spack/spack/error.py:55 ==> [2021-07-07-11:46:32.477203] Error: All fetchers failed
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 772, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 500, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/fetch.py", line 86, in fetch
    package.do_fetch()
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1379, in do_fetch
    self.stage.fetch(mirror_only, err_msg=err_msg)
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/pattern.py", line 23, in __call__
    return [getattr(item, self.name)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/pattern.py", line 23, in <listcomp>
    return [getattr(item, self.name)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/dzpolia/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/stage.py", line 503, in fetch
    raise fs.FetchError(err_msg or 'All fetchers failed', None)
spack.fetch_strategy.FetchError: All fetchers failed```
```
### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3404-36ba640cbd
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** darwin-mojave-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

You shouldn't need these if you do a spack external find

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
